content: In Greek mythology, who famously flew too close to the sun using wings made of feathers and wax?

I believe it was Icarus who flew too close to the sun with wings made of feathers and wax. His father, Daedalus, had crafted the wings to escape from Crete, but Icarus ignored his father's warnings and flew too high, causing the wax to melt and him to fall into the sea.
